abstract.p: This treatise on geomancy consists of a table of geomantic figures and sixteen chapters devoted to their description; the names of the figures are of Arabic origin. The representation of the figures does not appear to be conventional; the first figure in the table and in the description is Layhan/Laetitia. As is common in geomancy, each figure is associated with a planet. The treatise sometimes omits the instructions for performing divination; for example, in the copy attested in MS Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Éthiopien d'Abbadie 86, fols 20r-27r. A copy in MS Rome, Società Geografica Italiana, 246, fols 93r-96r, contains the instructions, which are based on arithmetical procedures involving gemmatria and certain calendrical parameters. This procedure is not conventional for performing geomancy in other cultures.
